Notable deaths in 2020 ...  and Huetter founded Kraftwerk in 1970 after meeting at a music academy in Duesseldorf, the German industrial city that they made their base, and they rapidly dispensed entirely with acoustic instruments. The son of prominent modern architect Paul Schneider-Esleben, Schneider started out playing the flute, later customizing it with original electronic effects and applying the same techniques to violins and electric guitars. Subsequent artists like the Pet Shop Boys credit Kraftwerk's brand of rhythmic, minimalist noise, often generated on home-made electronic instruments at "Kling-Klang," their studio-cum-laboratory in Duesseldorf, with transforming the sound of popular music, starting out less than a year after the Woodstock rock festival ...
